block.label: Logistics

radio.label: Location
radio.title: Sample Source (web) / Location (web to clt)
radio.row: Oi Research- Online Interactive Research Limited

text.label: LocationCode
text.title: This is used to assign each location's unique identifying code from the Location question row label. Do not edit.

block.note: Edit logic based on country - if one country, use "True", if multiple countries, assign based on sample company. Make sure field department knows to alert you if they are adding a sample company

autofill.label: JobNumber
autofill.title: AI011 C by Charmin Price Elasticity - PackFlash 360 - US - Teaneck

html.label: Intro
html.p:
Hello and welcome to our survey!
Thank you in advance for your participation.  This study is very important to us and we ask that you answer each question carefully and completely.
While going through the survey, use the scroll bar on the right and bottom of your screen to move up and down through questions and images.  Please remember that there are no right or wrong answers.  We are only interested in your opinions.
Thank you again!  Let’s begin…

autofill.label: Months
autofill.title: Enter number of months here 1,3,6,12 for past purchased, BUMO

block.label: RecaptchaBlock
block.cond: Country.US or Country.UK or Country.CA or Country.ZA or Country.AU
block.html: You are not human! You cannot proceed further.

radio.label: ln2_results
radio.title: Results

title.p: Please provide an answer to this mathematical equation:

radio.label: Red_Herring_Grid
radio.title:
This is another question to test how well you’re able to read the question text and instructions.
For the year 2024, do you project your purchasing behavior for each of the following categories to decrease, remain the same, or increase?
radio.row: For this row please select "remain the same"

checkbox.label: S_PastParticipation
checkbox.title: Have you participated in a market research study within the past 2 weeks, on any of the following topics?

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you, or does anyone in your immediate family work for any of the following industries?
checkbox.row: Advertising agency or public relations firms
A graphic design or packaging firm
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of Frozen Meal products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of Beauty products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of Toilet Paper products

term.label: TERM_Industry
term.cond: (S_Industry.r1 or S_Industry.r2 or S_Industry.r3 or S_Industry.r6)

select.label: S_GroceryShop
select.title: How much of the household grocery shopping do you, yourself do?

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: Which of the following best describes how you identify?

number.label: S_Age
number.title: Please type in your age below.

select.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY
select.title: Which of the following best describes you?
select.choice: Black or African American, or Black British

checkbox.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY2
checkbox.title: Please select all of the following that describe you.
checkbox.row: Black or African American, or Black British

radio.label: S_Frequency
radio.title: How often have you purchased products in each of the following categories?

radio.label: v_FreqClutter1
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter1] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r1.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r1.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r1.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r1.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r1.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r1.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r1.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqClutter2
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter2] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r2.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r2.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r2.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r2.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r2.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r2.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r2.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqTest
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Category] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.TB.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.TB.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.TB.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.TB.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.TB.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.TB.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.TB.c7: data.val=6

checkbox.label: Q_Retailer
checkbox.title: Where do you typically buy Toilet Paper products?

radio.label: Q1
radio.title: Which one statement best describes how you think about the price and value of toilet tissue products in general?
radio.row: I buy the lowest priced toilet tissue products
I routinely buy the lowest priced toilet tissue products from among a limited set of acceptable brands I trust
I found a toilet tissue product that is better than other brands and it costs less, so I stick to it
I occasionally pay a little extra for toilet tissue products I like or think are a little better
I routinely pay a little extra for toilet tissue products I like or think are a little
Price is not something I think about when buying a toilet tissue product - I buy what I want and don't worry about price

radio.label: Q2
radio.title: Please provide an answer for each of the following statements.
radio.row: I like to treat myself to little luxuries
All toilet tissue for the home is pretty much the same

checkbox.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased2
checkbox.title: Which brand or brands of Toilet Paper Products have you purchased in the past 3 months?
checkbox.row: Dollar General Home or Family Dollar Home
Great Value Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Walmart brand)
Home Sense Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Kroger brand)
Up & Up Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Target brand)

autofill.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) - User/Non User for Database

radio.label: S_Brand_BUMO2
radio.title: And which one brand of Toilet Paper Products have you purchased most often in the past 3 months?
radio.row: Dollar General Home or Family Dollar Home
Great Value Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Walmart brand)
Home Sense Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Kroger brand)
Up & Up Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Target brand)

autofill.label: S_Brand_BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

checkbox.label: Q_SubBrand
checkbox.title: You mentioned you purchased Charmin in the past 3 month. Which of the following have you purchased specifically?

row.label: r1
row.autofill: ((Q1.r5 or Q1.r6) and (Q2.r1.c1 or Q2.r1.c2) and (Q2.r2.c4 or Q2.r2.c5) and ((S_Brand_BUMO2.r4 or S_Brand_BUMO2.r5 or S_Brand_BUMO2.r9 or S_Brand_BUMO2.r11 or S_Brand_BUMO2.r13 or S_Brand_BUMO2.r14 or S_Brand_BUMO2.r15 or S_Brand_BUMO2.r16) or (Q_SubBrand.r3 or Q_SubBrand.r4 or Q_SubBrand.r5 or Q_SubBrand.r6)))

row.label: r3
row.autofill: (S_Gender.r3 or S_Gender.r4 or S_Gender.r5 or S_Gender.r6)

autofill.label: Usage
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) FULL LIST - LEAVE AS IS UNLESS YOU NEED CREATE NETTED LIST FOR QUOTA PURPOSES - ALL BRANDS MUST BE INCLUDED IF YOU NET THIS QUESTION.
autofill.row: Dollar General Home or Family Dollar Home
Great Value Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Walmart brand)
Home Sense Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Kroger brand)
Up & Up Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Target brand)

autofill.label: BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO FULL LIST - LEAVE AS IS UNLESS YOU NEED CREATE NETTED LIST FOR QUOTA PURPOSES - ALL BRANDS MUST BE INCLUDED IF YOU NET THIS QUESTION.
autofill.row: Dollar General Home or Family Dollar Home
Great Value Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Walmart brand)
Home Sense Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Kroger brand)
Up & Up Ultra Soft or Ultra Strong (Target brand)

autofill.label: User
autofill.title: This is "user" as defined by the insights team - the user by which they are running their data in crosstabs (and thus the norms)- this is defined as either past purchased or BUMO – as instructed by insights. Logic will be the same as S_Brand_PastPurchased OR S_Brand_BUMO.

autofill.label: SubGroups
autofill.title: This is used to capture the subgroups to be combined from Cat Rep and Supplements and to be brought into RealEye filters.

radio.label: Phase
radio.title: Phase

radio.label: S_Omni_Research
radio.title: Thinking about the [pipe: Category] category, how much browsing or research do you typically do "online" and "in store"  before shopping?

radio.label: S_Omni_ShoppingPlan
radio.title: Thinking about the [pipe: Category] category, and the different occasions when you shop it, would you say your shopping is more planned or impromptu?

number.label: resp_id
number.title: Respondent ID

block.label: AgreementBlock
block.note: THIS QUESTION SHOULD BE LEFT IN TO ENSURE QUALITY OF INTERVIEWING AND THAT IT'S NOT A BOT TAKING THE SURVEY

title.p:
During this survey you will be asked questions with detailed instructions and it is important that you read them closely and answer honestly so we may understand you better.
This question is a test to see how well you’re able to read the question text and
instructions.
From the list below, please select only "[pipe: Red_Herring_Activity_TRAP]" and do not select any other responses.

radio.label: RedHerringCheck
radio.title: Which of the following is not a color?

div.ul:
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
You will use information or material disclosed to you or which may be available as part of this study only for the purpose of participating in this study, and you will not otherwise use the information or material for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
You agree to keep confidential and not disclose, copy, transmit, or use for any purpose other than your participation in this study any information or material disclosed or made available to you as part of the study, including about products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this study. Any disclosure, copying, transmitting or misuse of any information or material in any form (including hard copy and/or electronic/data) whether intentional or unintentional may subject you to disqualification, and any other remedies available to Behaviorally or its study partners in law or equity.
You agree that Behaviorally (and its partners) will be irreparably harmed and monetary damages may not be adequate compensation if you fail to meet your obligations under this agreement, and that, in addition to other remedies, Behaviorally (or its partners) shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief to prevent any threatened or continued breach. The parties hereby waive any requirements for security for obtaining any provisional relief.
Each of Behaviorally’s partners is an intended third-party beneficiary of this agreement and each partner may enforce the terms of this agreement.

title.p:
As further detailed in our privacy policy (https://www.behaviorally.com/privacy-policy), we take reasonable precautions to protect the privacy and security of your information during the market research survey. All information collected as part of this survey is treated in accordance with our online privacy policy and is destroyed 2 months after you have taken this survey. You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

row.label: r1
row.b: I hereby acknowledge and agree to the terms.

text.label: DateTime
text.title: DateTime
text.exec:
from datetime import datetime
cur_time = datetime.now() DateTime.val = cur_time.strftime("%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S")

block.label: GaborExercise
block.builder:title: Gabor Exercise
block.html: For the next few questions, please focus your attention on the Charmin packaging you see here.

radio.label: Q_GG
radio.title: How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the price you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG1
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG2
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG1] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG3
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG2] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG4
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG3] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG5
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG4] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG6
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG7
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG6] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG8
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG7] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG9
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG8] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

radio.label: Q_GG10
radio.title: You mentioned you [pipe:Q_GG9] this [pipe: Brand] product for the price that was shown. How likely would you be to buy this [pipe: Brand] product, if it were available for the new prices you see below?

checkbox.label: Final_Price
checkbox.title: The final price/last price shown in the Gabor Granger exercise.

radio.label: Q_Value
radio.title: Thinking about the prices you saw, which of the following best describes how you feel about this product’s price overall?
radio.row: A great deal for the value
Too expensive for what it is

radio.label: Q_Value_Data
radio.title: Q_Value Response.
radio.exec: if Q_Value.r1: Q_Value_Data.val = 0 if Q_Value.r2: Q_Value_Data.val = 1 if Q_Value.r3: Q_Value_Data.val = 2 if Q_Value.r4: Q_Value_Data.val = 3 if Q_Value.r5: Q_Value_Data.val = 4
radio.row: A great deal for the value
Too expensive for what it is

em.b: Now, just a few questions for classification purposes…

select.label: S_State
select.title: Please select the US state in which you currently live:

select.label: C_Employment
select.title: Which of the following best describes your current employment status?

select.label: STANDARD_EDUCATION
select.title: What is the highest level of education you have completed?
select.choice: Other post high school vocational training
Completed some college, but no degree
Completed some graduate, but no degree

select.label: STANDARD_INCOME
select.title: Please select the range that best represents your total annual household income.
